adjective.description: Relating to or consisting of the subscription of a letter or other document. rare.
Relating to the subscribing of money; of the nature of, consisting of, or supported by a (usually monetary) subscription.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in Samuel Richardson (bap. 1689, d. 1761), printer and author. From classical Latin subscript-, past participial stem of subscrībere subscribe + -ive.
